result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: This case dismissed and read in per agreement of parties for disposition this date in 16CM23 and 16CM47. Minutes taken in those cases.

16CM12, 16CM23, and 16CM47.  1:40 p.m. Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Defendant Travis J. Burrow. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Travis J. Burrow not in court. Def is presently at Oshkosh Correctional. Writ was not done to secure his appearance today. DA asks for reset. Court sets 6/14 at 1:30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
